Renderer¶

class csoundengine.Renderer(sr=None, nchnls=2, ksmps=None, a4=None, maxpriorities=10, bucketsize=100)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Renderer is used when rendering offline.

Instruments with higher priority are assured to be evaluated later in the chain. Instruments within a given priority are evaluated in the order they are defined (first defined is evaluated first)

Parameters

  • sr (Optional[int]) – the sampling rate

  • nchnls (int) – number of channels

  • ksmps (Optional[int]) – csound ksmps

  • a4 (Optional[float]) – reference frequency

  • maxpriorities – max. groups

  • bucketsize – max. number of instruments per priority group

Methods Documentation

addGlobalCode(code)[source]¶

Add global code (instr 0)

Return type

automatep(event, param, pairs, mode='linear', delay=None)[source]¶

Automate a pfield of a scheduled event

Parameters

  • event (ScoreEvent) – the event to automate, as returned by sched

  • param (str) – the name of the parameter to automate. The instr should have a corresponding line of the sort “kparam = pn”

  • pairs (Union[List[float], ndarray]) – the automateion data as a flat list [t0, y0, t1, y1, …], where the times are relative to the start of the automation event

  • mode (str) – one of “linear”, “cos”, “smooth”, “exp=xx” (see interp1d)

  • delay (Optional[float]) – start time of the automation event. If None is given, the start time of the automated event will be used.

Return type

None

render(outfile=None, samplefmt=None, wait=True, quiet=False, openWhenDone=False)[source]¶

Render to a soundfile

To further customize the render set any csound options via Renderer.setCsoundOptions()

By default, if the output is an uncompressed file (.wav, .aif) the sample format is set to float32 (csound defaults to 16 bit pcm)

Parameters

  • outfile (Optional[str]) – the output file to render to. None will render to a temp file

  • samplefmt (Optional[str]) – the sample format of the rendered file, given as ‘pcmXX’ or ‘floatXX’, where XX represent the bit-depth (‘pcm16’, ‘float32’, etc)

  • wait – if True this method will block until the underlying process exits

  • quiet – if True, all output from the csound subprocess is supressed

  • openWhenDone – open the file in the default application after rendering

Return type

str

Returns

the path of the rendered file

sched(instrname, delay=0.0, dur=- 1.0, priority=1, pargs=None, tabargs=None, unique=True, **pkws)[source]¶

Schedule an event

Parameters

  • instrname (str) – the name of the already registered instrument

  • priority – the priority 1-9, will decide the order of execution

  • delay – time offset

  • dur – duration of this event. -1: endless

  • pargs (Union[List[float], Dict[str, float], None]) – pargs beginning with p5 (p1: instrnum, p2: delay, p3: duration, p4: tabnum)

  • tabargs (Optional[Dict[str, float]]) – a dict of the form param: value, to initialize values in the exchange table (if defined by the given instrument)

  • unique (bool) – if True, schedule a unique instance.

Return type

ScoreEvent

Returns

a ScoreEvent, holding the csound event (p1, start, dur, args)

setCsoundOptions(*options)[source]¶

Set any command line options

Parameters

*options (str) – any option will be passed directly to csound when rendering

Examples

>>> renderer = Renderer(...)
>>> instr = Instr("sine", ...)
>>> renderer.registerInstr(instr)
>>> renderer.sched("sine", ...)
>>> renderer.setCsoundOptions("--omacro:MYMACRO=foo")
>>> renderer.render("outfile.wav")
Return type

None

setp(event, delay, *args, **kws)[source]¶

Modify a pfield of a scheduled event at the given time NB: the instr needs to have assigned the pfield to a k-rate variable (example: kfreq = p4

strSet(s)[source]¶

Set a string in this renderer. The string can be retrieved in any instrument via strget. The index is determined by the Renderer itself, and it is guaranteed that calling strSet with the same string will result in the same index

Parameters

s (str) – the string to set

Return type

int

Returns

the string id. This can be passed to any instrument to retrieve the given string

Generate the csd for this renderer, write it to outfile

Return type

None
